intro: Euryspermum concolor, commonly known as the smoothleaf euryspermum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its smooth, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in sagebrush steppe ecosystems. The species is notable for its resilience to arid conditions and its role in supporting local pollinators.
